result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Michael Gordon Bredeson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Michael Gordon Bredeson in court.  Attorney Eric Daniel Lowenberg in court for Michael Gordon Bredeson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defense counsel has discovery from prior counsel and requests a scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Adjustment Number: 22A 095075,
Payable Number: 1037071,
Receipt Number: 22RP040092,
Amount: $20.00

Defendant Michael Gordon Bredeson in court.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted appeared by video for Michael Gordon Bredeson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Status conference held. Defendant advises the Court he plans to hire a private attorney. Court continues to take the request to withdraw as counsel under advisement. Case is adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Gordon Bredeson appeared by video.  Attorney Michael B Plaisted in court for Michael Gordon Bredeson.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel moves to withdraw. Defendant wants to hire his own attorney. Court takes request under advisement and sets matter for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.
Status conference scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Michael Gordon Bredeson in court.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Pre-trial conference held. Court conducted Indigency Hearing. Court held colloquy with defendant. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court. Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Atty. Michael Plaisted, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $50.00 per month beginning at the completion of the case, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MJ.
Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

ADDRESS INFO for Michael Gordon Bredeson
Current: 6163 Highland Lane, Greendale, WI 53129 United States  (Effective: 07-14-2022)
Prior: 8722 West Mitchell Street, #2, West Allis, WI 53214

Defendant Michael Gordon Bredeson in court.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
 Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 29.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 07/14/2022@2:00pm
